name: add_attributes(image_id: str, classname: str, attributes: list) -> dict

variables.name: image_id
variables.description: The unique identifier of the image;

variables.name: attributes
variables.description: A list of attributes to be added to the class.

example_code: <execute> add_attributes('12345abcde', 'coyote', ['four-legged mammal', 'brown, grey, or black fur']) </execute>

example_conversation_prompt.content: Can you add 'four-legged mammal' and 'brown, grey, or black fur' to 'coyote' class?

 new_attributes=['four-legged mammal', 'brown, grey, or black fur']

Question: Can you add 'four-legged mammal' and 'brown, grey, or black fur' to 'coyote' class?
add_attributes('12345abcde', 'coyote', ['four-legged mammal', 'brown, grey, or black fur'])
